oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Powder horn
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: According to a family tradition, a group of Union soldiers wintered on the Cassetty farm in Clay County, Tenn. and carved this small priming horn. When the soldiers departed they presented it to Elias Odius Cassetty.; Carved on the horn is a flag, musket, decorative leaves, and the year 1867. Priming horns were used to hold a finer granulated grade of black powder and were used to prime the pan of a flintlock style weapon.
